screenlet.label: The following simply includes two local screens that were included from another file with include-screens directive. Because the target includes were regular screens containing widgets, they were created in our local file by include-screens using simple delegating directives containing the legacy include-screen directive. No surprises here.

widgets.label: The following tests the actions includes produced by include-screens directive. In the next, the first two should print because they contained only actions, so they were implemented by include-screens with an include-screen-actions delegate/placeholder, and this ensures the include-screen-actions we just ran work transitively and succeed. The two after should come up blank because they contained widgets and condition, so include-screens implemented their delegates with include-screen, and the include-screen-actions we just ran above is not able to follow those. This highlights the importance of creating the right kind of screens, in order for reuse to work after.
